name: Thruster
how_to_perform:
1. Start with your feet shoulder-width apart and hands on the floor or a platform, with your arms directly under your shoulders.
2. Kick back into a plank position, while keeping your legs straight.
3. Quickly lower your body by bending at the elbows until you place both palms on the ground or platform.
4. Do not touch your knees to the chest, if doing the thruster with no platform.
5. From this bottomed-out position, jump your entire body forward - propelling yourself with both arms and legs.
6. Land softly in a squat position, with your hands still on the ground or platform.
7. Then, stand up from the squat by driving through both heels.
8. Immediately return to the starting position, where you kicked back into a plank.
short_summary: Thrusters are dynamic movements that strengthen multiple leg muscles while engaging smaller stabilizer muscles and is similar to a combination of Squat-Thrusters and Burpees with an emphasis on propulsion forward using both arms and legs.
